data.title: Painters Eleven
data.meta_description: History of Painters Eleven, a group of Canadian abstract expressionist painters active from the early 1950s, influenced by American art critic Clement Greenberg, several became known internationally.
data.text:
Born William Ronald Smith in Stratford Ontario. William Ronald graduates from the Ontario College of Art in 1952 then studies with Hans Hoffmann for six weeks in 1952 in New York. He arranges the first Painters Eleven exhibition in America in 1956 at the Riverside Museum in association with the American Abstract Artists (AAA). Ronald has his first American one-man show at the Kootz Gallery in 1957 and for the next seven years was represented along side of some of the most important artists in the world. Disregarding Jock Macdonald's advice "Never come back to Canada" Ronald returns to Canada in 1963 and exhibits in Toronto first with the Mirvish Gallery and later the Morris Gallery. Bill Ronald was one of Canada's most colorful and talented artists, one of the few you can call truly international. Bill's paintings are in almost every important art museum in North America. Image: Harlem Talk 1954 � Helen Ronald 2013

If you would like to inquire about selling or buying works of art, please click here http://www.painters-eleven.com/contact-us All inquires will be treated in confidence. Offers will be made without cost or obligation.We will travel to view major works. We purchase single items, artists' estates or complete collections. � Copyright 2013: Lynda M. Shearer.
